value: <l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">185</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">the horse had a green tail… What had happened 
            <choice>
              <sic>tp</sic>
              <corr>to</corr>
            </choice> her?</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">When she looked out again, the flowers had vanished.</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-bart" key="Oliver, Bartholomew">
            <choice>
              <sic>Bartholo mew</sic>
              <corr>Bartholomew</corr>
            </choice></rs> flicked on the reading lamp. The circle of</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">readers was lit up. There in that hollow of the sun baked</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">field were congregated the grass hopper, the ant, and the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">beetle, rolling pebbles of baked earth through the glistening</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">stubble. In that rosy corner of the sun baked field,</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">Bartholomew, <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-gile" key="Oliver, Giles">Giles</rs> and <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-lucy" key="Swithin, Lucy">Lucy</rs>, polished and nibbled, and broke off crumbs,</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">"A gentleman at <rs type="place" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#pla-surb" key="Surbiton">
            <choice>
              <sic>Subriton</sic>
              <corr>Surbiton</corr>
            </choice></rs> has seen a <rs type="object" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#obj-comm" key="Comma">comma</rs> in his</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">garden" Bartholomew announced.</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">The butterfly that looks 
              <choice>
              <sic>life</sic>
              <corr>like</corr>
            </choice> a leaf? Lucy queried.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">looking up from her letter.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">The newspaper dropped.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">"Done?" said Giles taking it from his fathers hand.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">The old man relinquished his paper. He basked,</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del hand="ms">silently</del>, in the mixed light; one hand, caressing the dog,</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">xixlxcx rippled folds of skin towards the collar.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">The clock ticked; the house gave little cracks as if it</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">were very brittle, very dry. <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-isa">Isa</rs> hand on the window sill</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">suddenly felt cold. Shadow had obliterated the garden.</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">Roses had 
            <choice>
              <sic>withdarwn</sic>
              <corr>withdrawn</corr>
            </choice> fxxm <add hand="typewriter" place="above">for</add> the night.	Mrs Swithin,</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">folding her letter, 
            <choice>
              <sic>l ant</sic>
              <corr>leant</corr>
            </choice> towards <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-isa" key="Oliver, Isa">Isa</rs> and said; "I looked</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">in and saw the babies; so happy; with the paper flowers on</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">their cots.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">Giles looked up from his newspaper; Isa became a</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">mother again, and also a wife.</l>
